website_summaries.verdict: For less than its centrifugal juicer competition, the Hamilton Beach 67601A Juice Extractor pulls the most liquid from citrus, even kale, than any centrifugal juicer we've tested to date.
pros: The Hamilton Beach 67601A Juice Extractor is affordably priced yet outperforms other juicers which cost twice as much
The 6760A Juice Extractor's large food chute and mouth accepts big pieces of fruit and vegetables and its parts are dishwasher safe
cons: With thin clamps, plastic design and no juice cup included, the Hamilton Beach 67601A Juice Extractor is not a luxury model
The machine lacks a cleaning brush as well, a standard accessory on most juicers

customer_reviews.title: Makes a lot of noise. Sprays pulp on my ...
customer_reviews.text: Makes a lot of noise. Sprays pulp on my kitchen walls. Creates a lot of foam in the juice. Mine lasted about 16 months with infrequent use. Put in some veggies one day that got stuck. Burned up the motor within seconds. That was the end of this juicer. I tried my parents' Omega juicer (which is about 4x the price) -- a pretty huge difference in quality. Very quiet and clean; juice tasted much better without all the foam. If I ever buy another juicer again, I'm going to make more of an investment, because you really do get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Windstar

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a relative. I gave my practically new stainless steel Jack LaLane juicer away to one relative, because I wasn't using it that much. So to keep another relative from being upset and feeling "left out" -- they're the jealous type -- I read the reviews on this one and bought it. I had to let the latter relative know that this juicer had been rated higher (note: I looked for the ratings on other websites) than my old juicer. That "jealous" relative was very, very happy to see that they had gotten the "better" juicer. LOL
customer_reviews.author: gistm

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I knew going in not to expect the best juicer I'll ever own, but for my first juicer I think it works pretty darn well. I cut up my fruit and veggies smaller though to hopefully keep it working well for as long as I can. Clean up really isn't as terrible as I expected either. My mom's more expensive juicer has so many parts to it that it takes forever to clean, but this one has a minimal amount of pieces. I usually put a grocery bag in the pulp catcher for easy cleanup also. For a first juicer, I'd say this is a good one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole A

customer_reviews.title: decent juicer for the money
customer_reviews.text: This juicer was $59.99 so I was expecting amazing, however a few years back I ordered one for $45 (I can't recall the brand) that I lent to someone....I'll never see it again that I liked better. Back to the juicer... Cons.. I notice a lot of the pulp is still quite moist, a lot of juice is still in there. I'm also disappointed it doesn't come with a cup/container for the juice like my last juicer. The photograph is deceiving, the mouth really isn't that big, not big enough to fit the small granny smith apples I bought anyway. Pluses.. It works It was cheap Clean up isn't so bad
customer_reviews.author: teazleblossom

customer_reviews.title: omg
customer_reviews.text: Gosh! I got this juicer recently I love it cleaning up is so easy with the brush that comes with the juicer. I place a plastic bag in the pulp collector and that's a done deal...loving it. Updated review..1/13/14..well my juicer broke today not yet a year 2 weeks shy of a year and this morning was extracting some juice and started smelling something burning when I check it was under the bottom of the shredding blade where it attaches to the base under it was burnt rubber and the unit was smoking...so much for my big mouth juicher...this juicer was not used on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: dd

customer_reviews.title: Kate's careful reviews
customer_reviews.text: My first juice extractor. I read all the reviews and looked at all the prices, and chose this one. My son has a stainless steel extractor that cost a lot of money, but is in to juicing in a big way for his family of four. This is absolutely adequate as I juice once or twice a week, and am learning what suits me. I have no quarrel with this product, as it is strong and is easy to clean. I wish the mouth was a little wider. I love to juice, and find it very exciting. I am going down to the local herb store and will get more information about adding herbs. I already add dried kelp.
customer_reviews.author: Kate's Careful Reviews Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Read all the reviews before I bought
customer_reviews.text: I like to read all the reviews before I buy a product. The reviews for this extractor were far better than more expensive models. Having never used a juicing machine before I really didn't want to spend a great deal in the event I didn't like juicing. This model works great! I was doing a juicing fast and I had no problem with any of the fruits and vegetable I used in the machine. The small brush included to clean the strainer was wonderful. I really have nothing negative to say about it. A great buy for the beginner or long time user.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Juice extractor
customer_reviews.text: I just LOVE my juice extractor, but would definitely recommend that you read the manual through before using the first time. One of the best tips that I found from reading other users' reviews was to place a plastic shopping bag into the pulp receptacle...totally makes the cleanup even easier. The machine comes nicely packaged and with a manual, that includes some recipes. I read alot of reviews on different types of machines and this is perfect for making my own juices to be used for making protein drinks in my Ninja. I would totally recommend this machine to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works better than a lot of expensive ones
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to see if we liked juicing before buying a more expensive one (I tend to become obsessed with something and then lose interest later on). I am not sure we will need to buy a more expensive juicer for awhile. I've watched youtube videos comparing the Horum to more expensive models. This $49 model gets the juice out so well that the pulp is completely dry. Sure, it makes noise while using it, but we aren't using it 24 hours a day. We use it every day and it is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: In Cape Coma

customer_reviews.title: OK...not great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this juicer after my Breville blew up (that one lasted about 20 uses before the motor blew) thinking it would last longer and liking that it had a more powerful motor. It is powerful but only has one speed which spews carrot pulp all over my cabinets every time I pull the plunger out to feed more into it. It would take forever to juice if I turned it off every time I fed more product into it. Also it leaks and has no container included. Not a well thought out juicer. I recommend paying a little more for a juicer with a better track record.
customer_reviews.author: dandnic

customer_reviews.title: Works well, kinda annoying to clean
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I just felt like it was a pain to clean and was wasting a lot of the fruit and my money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY LOUD
customer_reviews.text: Not only is it the loudest appliance I have ever heard.. it literally walks across the counter.. it like bounces.. causing the container you are juicing into to move around the counter too and then juice gets everywhere. If that wasn't bad enough, it doesn't juice well enough at all. You can run the pulp through again and get TONS of juice. Like I ran through some pulp into a measuring cup and I got literally 2/3 cup more of juice! Huge waste.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great for Price, Easy Clean Up
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I am absolutely in love with my juicer. I've had it for a little under a year ( I believe) and use it around 4-5 times a week. When I moved across country I didn't use it for a couple months and the on/off button has become hard to turn. I am unsure how to clean it, so that's a concern. I bought this juicer because I was new to juicing and didn't know if I could commit. Now that I know I can, I will likely replace it with a better model
customer_reviews.author: Britney

customer_reviews.title: Great Juicer  for 4months
customer_reviews.text: I have this juicer and loved it at first still do but reason I gave it a 4star was because it started to vibrate after a few months of constant use. Maybe that is why but then again it should handle making me a juice daily. But for the price its a good alternative if you juice occasionally. I just abuse this product in it's defense, but it is a good product plus good for small spaces. I just hold it down while juicing and no more issues. Still kicking after 1 yr of use
customer_reviews.author: Rigo

customer_reviews.title: Like a helicopter landing in our kitchen every morning
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine, especially for a $50 purchase. The clean up was super easy and there always seemed to be enough power to process whatever produce we threw in there. That said, it's deafeningly loud. I could not use it in the morning unless I wanted to wake up the whole house. I suppose that's how they had to cut corners to make it affordable. Nonetheless, it died after 10 months of regular use. We've upgraded to a much quieter (and 10 year warrantied) VRT model.
customer_reviews.author: Prime User

customer_reviews.title: Good juicer works as intended.
customer_reviews.text: I love this juicer, I have used it almost daily for 4 months, hasn't broken down, worked exactly as intended. Mind you, that does come with: - noise (no way to prevent unless you go cold press and they have their own problems) - clean up (same as above) This is a great juicer for beginners who are not looking for a high budget juicer but need time to figure out if they really want to get into juicing. This will work as you want and will chop up mostly anything so it's good to try with alternative and vegatable juicing as well. Bottomline: it works great and makes good juice and it's the juicer to go to for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: snist

customer_reviews.title: One Great Juicer
customer_reviews.text: I got this after seeing the documentary of fat, sick, and nearly dead. It wasn't the exact juicer they used in the documentary but it was pretty darn close. This thing worked so great. I had it for up to a year now and it still jucies the same as the first day I got it. I recommend cutting fruits in half so it can last longer. The juicer also came on time and was exactly what I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to "start" juicing, and it is amazing. I was worried that it wouldn't be as productive since it was "cheaper" than other brands, but I juice at least once a day (apples, kale, carrots, sweet potatoes, celery, etc) and it handles it all perfectly. Clean up is pretty easy...you must do it RIGHT AWAY...I do it before I even drink the juice. Only downside is none of my glasses fit under the spout they are all too tall... but I remedied that by putting my pyrek measuring cups under there.
customer_reviews.author: L J S

customer_reviews.title: GREAT juicer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Never had a juicer before and didn't know if I would like one so I didn't want to spend a fortuner on one. This juicer has been great for me. I use it about every three days. It is really easy to clean, I rinse it all off immediately after using it so none of the stuff dries on it so it's no problem. They even give you a little brush to use on the cutter part which works great. I would highly recommend this to somebody who isn't sure if juicing is for them and doesn't want to spend a fortune to find out.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Zee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the home!
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a juicer for $10 on ebay, 10 years ago and used it sporadically. I recently started to juice again and wanted a better one. Not wanting to fall into the hype of infomercial juicers, I looked on amazon. This was the only one with zero complaints, so I purchased it and it was a good choice. It is powerful, reasonably quiet and extracts a lot of juice. And I don't have to cut stuff into small pieces! A great buy for the home.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wasson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Takes time to thoroughly clean and juice! I wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Good enough juicer
customer_reviews.text: This juicer is pretty good, especially for the price. My only complaint is that it doesn't manage to get all of the liquid out of the pulp- and sometimes bigger chunks of the fruit or vegetable I am juicing end up in the pulp bin because the juicing mechanism isn't all that strong. Still, it works well enough for me to use at home every once in a while. If you are a serious juicer, you should probably spend the money on a higher quality machine.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Jane

customer_reviews.title: 1st Juicer but impressed
customer_reviews.text: The Juicer is easy to clean if you use a plastic bag in the pulp catcher, plus they even throw in a plastic brush to clean up the strainer etc so that you can clean up the mess. I like the fact that there is just one button "ON or Off" keep it simple for the user and we will be happy. It is loud but for a glass or two you will not have it on for a long time so no worries there. Powerful motor and Big Mouth so you really do not have to worry about slicing the vegetables or fruit. I would recommend for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Khalid Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than pictured
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after watching a documentary and thought I'd give juicing a try. While this little machine seems to work pretty good, don't be fooled by it fitting an entire apple... not gonna happen unless it's the tiniest of tiny apples. And its LOUD! And it's kind of a pain to clean. I got some juice out of it, but only ended up using it a couple times. I'd rather just, eat fruit and vegetables in their original form!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Masaitis

customer_reviews.title: It's doing a great job
customer_reviews.text: This is a good deal. It does a better job than a friend's who paid nearly $200.00 for her juicer. We use it daily. The fruit juices are wonderful. The vegetable juices - well, yuk, but not the machine's fault - it's like taking my medicine - but good and healthy. Even juices leaves like spinach which I heard some cheap machines won't do. Clean-up takes a few minutes, but not a problem - we got in the habit of doing cleanup of the machine immediately after juicing.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great juicer for the money
customer_reviews.text: This juicer is great. I use carrots and celery mostly so I do not know how it does with other stuff. I also use ginger, but you need to process that last because ginger is fibrous and clogs the processing disc. I like the large mouth feeder, I can use a big handful of carrots and celery. I use the "waste" for when I cook my beans...so I have no complaints with "waste". Powerful motor...ease of use and easy to clean. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Maximilian Lucado

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for a friend and for myself. he just started using it last month and loved it. was using it everyday and it broke yesterday! after a month...not cool! Follow up- The machine is fine now. Apparently it just didn't work that one time but my friend has had it for a long time, uses it everyday now and it works perfectly. He couldn't believe how little I paid for it, he thought it was much more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: SCB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I am still trying this, prepared my first juices I believe is a great and powerful juicer. This is going to be a great help for me which I am suffering some heart issues and is a great way of preparing vegetable and fruit juices. It is so powerful and so easy to clean, and just that big mouth is amazing, I just put a whole apple, my husband could not believe me that you do not neet to cut the apples like it happens with other juices, so that is a great . Big Mouth Big juicer
customer_reviews.author: Macbeth

customer_reviews.title: Great Juicer
customer_reviews.text: new to juicing so I did not want to buy an expensive juicer. Saw this one on Amazon and liked what I saw. I have been using my juicer every day since it arrived and I can honestly say that I am thrilled, The wide mouth is wonderful, don;t have to chop up veggies and fruit, it can take a whole apple. It has a powerful motor and works just as well if not better than the expensive ones. Clean up is quick and easy, a wee bit loud but a very small price to pay, love it.
customer_reviews.author: mo

customer_reviews.title: Good juicer
customer_reviews.text: Jumping on board the juicing craze we purchased this juicer after reading comments/reviews. It works though noisy. It is a hassle to clean and MUST be cleaned as soon as you are done using. A plastic bag in the catch bin makes that mess easier to deal with. We've since stored this juicer and started using the Nutribullet. We'd rather EAT the fiber up instead of tossing it. As juicers go, for the price, yes, I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robby Berardi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Juicer
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that this juicer would not perform as it is quite a bit cheaper than some of the big brands, but this surpassed all of my expectations! We juice every 10 days. We eat healthy for 10 days and then we juice for 3 days straight. It easily makes enough juice to fill several squeeze bottles for my husband and I each day very quickly. You don't have to chop the fruits and veggies very small and it is easy to clean and assemble. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Fun Mom

customer_reviews.title: I think this Big Mouth Juice Extractor is the best in terms of cost effectiveness
customer_reviews.text: I have tried out many different brands. Unless you want a juicer with adjustable dials specifically for soft veggies, hard veggies, leafy veggies, soft fruit, etc. I think this Big Mouth Juice Extractor is the best in terms of cost effectiveness. It does a great job on hard veggies like beets, carrots, kale and also apples but it is not designed for soft leafy veggies like spinach.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST VALUE EVER
customer_reviews.text: We use this product everyday. Literally. I can't say enough good things about this juicer.....we had a friend recommend another juicer when our last one took it's last breath and that one cost over $200 and it was awful. I went straight onto Amazon and bought another Hamilton Beach. At 80 bucks you can expect to use this juicer everyday for 3 months, before the blades will be blunt or the motor will have been exhausted. Outstanding value for money!
customer_reviews.author: MartinKinLA

customer_reviews.title: works great for larger items
customer_reviews.text: i bought this after going on a health kick. i wanted to make my own wheat grass shots. after purchasing this i learned that it doesn't really juice the small items very well. i have to run the wheat grass through with larger items. with the larger items such as apples, carrots, ect it works really well. the pulp is put in a different container and when you put a plastic bag in the container it makes cleanup a breeze. totally in love with this, apple cider is delicious when made from scratch...
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I was introduced to juicing by watching "Fat, Sick and Nearly Dead." I did not want to spend a lot of money, but this juicer is a very good product. I would have given it 5 stars, but it is rather loud. It does a great job of completely juicing. I do find that cleaning the straining basket is a bit difficult, but that is because it does such a great job of juicing! All parts (except the motor housing, of course) may be put in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Big Mouth Juicer
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace our expensive juicer that broke. This one is far superior. It is very easy to clean, which is often not the case with juicers. A large glass fits under the spout as well. I feel like it really gets all of the juice out as well because the pulp that is left over is not very wet. An added bonus is that it also makes soy or almond milk! Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Splash

customer_reviews.title: It'll juice your face off!
customer_reviews.text: Not literally, it's a great juicer, especially for the price. Be warned tho, it's part airplane. This thing wants to take off like the Spruce Goose. If you get a particularly tough bunch of carrots, hold that thing down or it's going to shoot off into space. Well, not really, the cord isn't that long, it'd just slide off the counter and break. Then you'd be sad. Don't be sad. Do what I say. Juice away!
customer_reviews.author: friskevision

customer_reviews.title: Juicer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great juicer for the money, I see these $200+ juicers out there and this one takes the cake for $45. I have had no problems with it, though it does sound like a jet engine when using it, but I can tolerate the noise for a brief time. The clean up is tedious, but I am sure the clean up on all of them is about the same. Most of the parts clean up quick, its getting the juicer blade clean that will take a little time. All in all its a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Fletch

customer_reviews.title: Get What You Pay For!
customer_reviews.text: The juicer does it's job - it juices. You get what you pay for! I tried out a few carrots for my first test run. Extracted pulp came flying out a little slot at the top. I'm not sure why that slot is there... and whether or not I should cover it... but basically, by the time I got through 4 carrots, I had pulp on my cupboard, dish rack, and counter. I'm not an avid juicer. My first attempt on carrot juice had quite a bit of pulp in it, which I don't mind.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Juicer review
customer_reviews.text: For my first juicer I think it works great. used it 6 times or so. kind of messy but its doing a messy job. Makes juice like it is supposed to and for the price it was nice. Loud and violent are the drawbacks but i have no other to compare it too. I would not be able to make juice while the kids are sleeping. time consuming to clean but for what it does its expected. Place a grocery bag in the pulp container to help with easier clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: switch flaw
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Hamilton Beach Big Mouth Juicer...until yesterday. I juice daily...mostly vegetables with a piece of fruit mixed in...an apple or a pear, for flavor. It worked very well for exactly one year. At that time, the switch broke. I was disappointed...Other than this single flaw, it was a perfect experience. Anyone know how to fix a broken switch? If you have the extra money, buy the Big Mouth Juicer with a toggle switch! It would be worth the money not to have to get rid of an otherwise perfect juicer!
customer_reviews.author: lin8

customer_reviews.title: Best Juicer out there for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I love this juicer! It's the 2nd one I've owned and the ease of use and cleaning can't be beat! The wide mouth isn't wide enough for most apples, but that's no problem. It juices well and consistently; I use it every morning and sometimes I don't have the time to clean it until after work. I always use a plastic shopping bag in the recepticle for the pulp and never have to clean that out. Works like a charm! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Debra D.

customer_reviews.title: Big Mouth Satisfaction...
customer_reviews.text: Health is more important each day and as the years go on, your going wish you had a juicer. Nothing is better than fresh juice that you make yourself. Take the time to study this product and trust me it works just great and its a special treat to have juice that you know has no additives in it.... all natural... all the way. Yes, its easy to clean and looks great on the kitchen table. Love it and you will too.
customer_reviews.author: Winston Blakely

customer_reviews.title: Good for the $
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this juicer. I have used it over and over and over for the last 5 months or so. It's a nice juicer for the price. It has become a bit sluggish of late, so I kind of don't expect it to last much longer. If you want a juicer that's going to last, this may not be the one. Also, this juicer leaves a lot of produce unjuiced. So many times it chews up the fruit and kicks it through in chunks without getting all the juice out of the fruit/veggies.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: It's good over all - beware that the cup is not included
customer_reviews.text: I'll just highlighting the important points: Pro: *Price - at around $50 this is pretty good *Easy to assemble *Easy enough to clean - the mesh is the most time consuming part *Gets the job done Con: *Not as efficient as the masticating juicer *Loud *Does not include a cup like it display in the picture *Mesh is always harder to clean - I found the brush gets stuck to the mesh sometimes This is a good choice for anyone that want to try or start juicing.
customer_reviews.author: Bubble Knight

customer_reviews.title: First Juicer I Bought and I Love It
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I started a diet at the first of the year and added juicing to supplement our other healthy choices and to add some variety to our diet. This juicer works great and is able to easily handle anything we have thrown in there - from carrots to beats to pineapple to apples and pears. I loved the tips of adding a plastic bag to the pulp canister to make clean-up even easier. Does a great job getting the most juice out of all fruits, veggies and herbs. Cleanup is a snap and it easily stores on the counter to make it even more convenient to whip up a juice concoction at any time of day.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Rose

customer_reviews.title: easy, quiet juicer
customer_reviews.text: it's easy, it's not too loud, and it juices. this is my first juicer and i don't know how much juicing is in my future but it seems like a good one. i find juicing kind of a pain in the butt, but this is a good one, seems powerful, makes juice. it's very easy to assemble. it's not tiny (i have a studio apt) so it takes up some room. i recommend rinsing it all out immediately after using to make cleanup wayyyy easier.
customer_reviews.author: mirabel

customer_reviews.title: Good Machine
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a 5 star based on the Consumer Magazine said for the price it was pretty good machine. I wanted to try a juicer and not break the bank. Being a beginner juicer I wanted a machine to try out before really investing a lot of money. At this time I had no problems with the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Sholly6

customer_reviews.title: Great Juicer
customer_reviews.text: After reading about the benefits of juicing, I decided I would purchase a relatively inexpensive juicer (with good reviews, of course). The Hamilton has been great. It's noisy, but I assume any juicer would create a certain amount of sound. It's easy to take apart to clean and reassemble. It is a bit bulky and you need some counter space or a good place to store it, but it is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: I love this juicer. I have had it for a month and use it everyday. It does a great job. For a beginner juicer the price was right. Hopeful it will last a while before going dull, but it does have plenty of power. I recommend it for the thrifty juicer. Clean up is not bad either, just take apart and rinse. Easy to take apart and put back together.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lesondak

customer_reviews.title: juicing for health is a good idea
customer_reviews.text: I juice for extra energy, and to get vitamins and minerals I need without having to eat extra food or resort to pills. I juice once or twice a day, have one vegetable, fruit, and protein drink in the a.m., and one fair sized healthy meal mid-afternoon. I have more energy than ever, and feel great. It is so much better than buying canned or bottled juice.
customer_reviews.author: grammajanet

customer_reviews.title: Great juicer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy the Hamilton Beach big mouth juicer. The price on Amazon is outstanding and the Prime member shipping is just frosting on top. The key to making this last is cleaning it well right after use. Don't let it sit around. I find that the blade is not as sharp already and I don't think I am that heavy of a user, but I am still happy with it and am looking to buy an extra blade for back up.
customer_reviews.author: unspeakable joy

customer_reviews.title: Good juicer for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is the 1st juicer I've owned. I've used this about 6 times now. I have used carrots, apples, kale, cucumbers, beets and it juices all of them well. All the parts in the juicer are removable and can be cleaned. I usually take the pulp and juice it again with some water to extract any remaining juice. So far this has worked well. Definitely recommend this as a 1st juicer. I know some juicers produce a lot of juice and this one in comparison doesn't in the 1st attempt (hence a good juicer for beginners :P ).
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Not working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I am highly disappointed that my machine just stop working today as we speak. So now I have a lot of fruit with no machine to juice it with. The machine will not turn on after I plug it in. The manual stated to check and make sure the the locking latch are correctly engaged. I have tried everything the manual say to do. VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.author: S Walker

customer_reviews.title: worked great
customer_reviews.text: we did find that it was difficult to juice some fruits such as black berries without having some of the fruit shoot back out at us so we actually added about a 1 foot long tube that essentially extends the input port. The tube caught about 90% of the projectiles and allowed for faster feeding of the fruits. WIth the tube in place the "pusher" was useless but it was not necessary for soft berries.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great product! haven't had a problem yet!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this juicer in September as a gift to someone and i've also used it a few times. We both agree best idea ever. I was even more motivated to make juice after seeing, "Fat, Sick & Nearly Dead" a 2011 documentary when this guy goes on a juice diet to save his life. Man I tell you, fruits and vegetables are the best thing for the body! The bible is right...
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: It didn't last very long using it on a daily bases, I was juicing carrots. The first one that I bought had better parts in it , but I dropped it and bought another one thinking it would be the same , The second one lasted about 5 months. The third one that I bought was a Jack La Lane Power Juicer. It did cost more , but I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Bud

customer_reviews.title: Great little juicer
customer_reviews.text: I started with an inexpensive juicer to see if I'd even like "juicing." The inexpensive juicer is awesome so I might not "upgrade;" there's no need. I use it hard every day. It grinds and pulps everything I put into it. It even withstood an accidental introducation of a peach pit. (Turned it off immediately). There are lots of parts to wash but, if I do it right away it's a breeze. I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: energy101

customer_reviews.title: Great Juice Extraction. Easy to clean. Very Noisy
customer_reviews.text: It extracts a good deal of juice, wheter your using soft or hard fruits and vegetables. The pulp is pretty dry usually :)... To clean, I just rinse it out with water and use the provided brush to clean the metal juice extraction sieve. This machine is very noise, but that's because there is a huge motor inside, so what do you expect :)... This juicer has no cup, unlikey the similar model with the toggle switch, which costs a about $10 more, but looks a bit fancier and gives you a large juice collection cup. Great juicer for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Mango

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Juicer!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! This juicer extracts a lot of juice! I was actually surprised a how much since it was not about $200 like a lot of others! I do not put whole apples in, or whole anything. I read that cutting the fruits and veggies up help and it will juice better, so that is what I do. I have 2 small kids and they love it! NO more sugary juice in this house!
customer_reviews.author: ElizabethK

customer_reviews.title: Its an okay juicer....
customer_reviews.text: Its an okay juicer. nothing super special. The thing I absolutely DO NOT like is how LOUD this juicer is. When you turn it on, its like you are in a wind tunnel. This makes it near impossible to juice in the morning before everyone wakes up. I am a "rookie" juicer, but it doesnt seem to produce that much juice either.
customer_reviews.author: britnib

customer_reviews.title: great for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have used this every day for a week and it is doing exactly as stated. I have a masticating juicer as well, but for soft fruit (strawberries, papaya, melons) I prefer this kind because it gets more juice out. We have a few chickens and they love the pulp. I have lost 9 lbs in 4 days just by juicing. So get it for your health. :)
customer_reviews.author: drgnslyr

customer_reviews.title: great juicer for the money
customer_reviews.text: we bought this to make fresh juice with vegetables and fruits. my entire family is impressed by the amount of juice this puppy squeezes out. the clean up is extremely easy honestly the most it takes me to clean this juicer is like 3 minutes after heavy use. i would recommend this juicer to anybody thats looking for a cheap yet good juicer thats easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Grizzz

customer_reviews.title: Convenient to use but some pulp gets into juice.
customer_reviews.text: We had the same model for over 5 years, liked it and it broke, so we bought it again, this time from Amazon. The quality of this extractor went down a lot. Quite a lot of pulp gets into juice, and the "dry" leftovers are not dry and retain juice. I.e. separation got worse. Other than that good machine, we've been using it for almost four months.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wasted  purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is impossible to use. Do you realize how much fruit or veggies are needed to make a Serving size of juice? It’s for those rich. Bottled juice is the way to go
customer_reviews.author: Ann M Thamm

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is my first juicer, so maybe my bar is low, but so far it has been working great for me! Juices come out perfectly strained and frothy (strawberries and kiwi did turnout a bit thicker than I anticipated, but it's fine once you thin out with some nut milk or water). Pulp is relatively dry, and I don't see much waste.
customer_reviews.author: Celina

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine but Hard to Clean
customer_reviews.text: The juicer works good and makes some very flavorful juices. It gives the juice a frothy head similar to a beer but non alcoholic. I really like that aspect, makes it feel like I am drinking something full of vitamins. The cleaning of the juicer is not extremely hard to do but it takes a little bit and if not done properly attracts ants.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Laudenslayer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Juicer
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these as gifts and showed the receipients how to use them. The mouth opening to put in food in is large - which is good and bad. Good in that you do not need to cut up your produce to small (I have a different brand of juice and musts cut the larger cuts in half so they will fit in the opening); bad in that if the food is tall (like carrots) the upper portion of the carrot wiggles all over the place; to eliminate this problem we have cut the veges in 1/2 so there isn't a large portion not in the opening when you begin to juice. The juicer itself works great.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and Affordable Juicer
customer_reviews.text: I was under the impression that a juicer had to be expensive in order for it to deliver. Not this one. My wife read many positive reviews about the Hamilton 67601 Big Mouth Juice Extractor and its price; she told me about it so we decided to go ahead and buy it. We have been using it everyday since the first day we got it and it has become and addiction for us. the unit easy to handle and to clean. It surpassed all of our expectations for a juicer within this price range. Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Bonilla

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best I have seen
customer_reviews.text: I use this for green juicing. It does make some odd sounds, which I think is normal but scares me to death at times. However, it does the job and does it well. I would never stick an entire apple in this machine. I cut all my vegs and fruits up because I do believe it would break the machine if you didn't. Other than that, it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Kaylee

customer_reviews.title: Still Going Strong After a Year!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Color me impressed! I was expecting this juicer to be decent but was pleasantly surprised that it's actually much better than just decent! Takes whole small apples and juices everything in a flash. Super easy cleanup compared to most! I've had mine a year now and it's still going strong after daily use!!
customer_reviews.author: Angie O’Gram

customer_reviews.title: It's not heavy duty so if you are a big juicer I wouldn't recommend. Great for beginners to try juicing
customer_reviews.text: This juicer does the job but clean up is a pain. I put a plastic bag inside to catch the pulp & it's still a mess. It's not heavy duty so if you are a big juicer I wouldn't recommend. Great for beginners to try juicing.
customer_reviews.author: KRS

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first juicer purchase. Didn't want to spend much money because I didnt know how much I would get into juicing. I use my juicer every other day & it is great. Cannot beat the price. Only thing is that it is loud which I saw in other reviews. Not a big deal though since it isnt something that runs all day. Very glad with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: SRB

customer_reviews.title: Health Choice!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Works very well, albeit my first juicer. High quality fruit brings you high quality juice. Couldn't be much simpler. Cons: Bananas don't work well at all. I suggest using the juice and banana(s) in a blender for best results.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Werbachowski Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Very good jucier for a decent price!
customer_reviews.text: Juicer works great... love the wide mouth, very powerful... We are also new to juicing so didn't want to go crazy and buy a real expensive one since we weren't sure we would use it a lot. Did my research & found this would be best for the quality & price... Very happy with our choice this one is perfect for us...
customer_reviews.author: D. Rohen

customer_reviews.title: Best juicer around
customer_reviews.text: Best juicer around !!!!! I was speaking to a friend of mine and he claimed this was the best. He is a "juice guru" so I believed him and I bought it. He said it would cost the cheapest $60 online so when I found it for $49.00 I jumped and bought it. It works amazing just like he said.
customer_reviews.author: natalie

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean and wonderful juice / sauce.
customer_reviews.text: This juicer is amazing so easy to clean! And i mean easy as cleaning regular dishes. I take the bad, seeds and stems,out my self so whats left over is like a nummy "apple sauce type stuff" that has nothing added to it! Apple blueberry juice is awesome! If you clean everything the stuff leftover in the bin is so good to eat. Why waist good food, can even use it as a butter alternative in baked goods!
customer_reviews.author: Nami the mother hen

customer_reviews.title: Best juicer ever
customer_reviews.text: Best juicer ever! This lasted me for well over three years (and I used it almost everyday), which is amazing considering the price. Its easy to clean (I would just put a plastic bag to collect the fruit pieces), effective, and well made. I bought a Breville Compact Fountain juicer and it honestly wasn't any better. I'd actually say it was worse b/c it was such a pain to clean. I highly recommend this juicer and will be purchasing it again!
customer_reviews.author: NewSarah

customer_reviews.title: Just bought another one!!
customer_reviews.text: I seldom leave reviews for items but I felt this was necessary. This is my second hamilton, I recently had purchased one for my parents. This is an amazing juicer in all aspects. Its super easy to use and extracts an incredible amount of juice. The best part is the cleaning process, very simple to take apart and even easier to clean. Usually holding the parts under a tap does the trick. I also suggest using a small bag and placing it where the pulp goes. I also like the foam this juicer created. Adds a nice texture. Simple easy and delicious juice.
customer_reviews.author: usman32

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can put whole food into mouth. But it does make a mess once you pull up the presser. The cleaning brush it comes with falls apart as soon as you start scrubbing the filter. It's a bit of a pain to pull all the little bristles out of the filter. Other than that , great price and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Great Juicer!!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife swears by this juicer! She uses it practically everyday since we got about a month ago. She said she loves it and that it does a good job as a juicer. It cleans easily enough but it is a little bulky. If you are looking for a big mouth juice extractor then this is it. Yes, I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Abad Santos

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for my buck
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried many juicers, but for the price this one does a great job. Handles everything from citrus to beets to berries well. Sometimes chunks of things like beets or apples or things like spinach and kale will shoot out into the pulp bin before they are juiced, but they are small enough that it doesn't bother me. I've only had this juicer for a short time so I can't say how the durability will be, but I've used it a lot in a short time and so far so good! Anyone who wants to start juicing but can't buy one of the really nice, more expensive juicers will love this.
customer_reviews.author: Mags

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I love this juicer. It yields a high amount of juice, its easy to use, and it being dishwasher safe is a huge plus. One issue is that it is rather loud, so juicing first thing in the morning while others are asleep is not an option. However, for the price it is worth it and I can overlook the noise.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Melody

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This juicer does the job but does leak out the side during the juicing process and is a HUGE pain to clean. I don't have much experience with other juicers so I don't have much to compare it to. I just know, personally, this product made juicing discouraging for me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: LUV IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this Hamilton Beach Big Mouth juicer to replace my Jack Lalaine juicer after many years of use. I was a bit skeptical that this juicer would be any good because of the great price. I must say though that this juicer is fabulous! I absolutely love it. It can handle anything and everything you throw at it. I've made green juices, carrot juice and beet juice. It extracts the juice well and does it quickly. Highly recommend this juicer.
customer_reviews.author: BrenC

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: This juicer works very well; has sufficient room for all the veggies/fruits you wish to include. However, the dispenser is too low which results in having to empty an 8oz glass into another glass when you desire a larger portion. Also, the strainer is a 'pill' to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Juicer
customer_reviews.text: The Hamilton Big Mouth Juice Extractor makes juice as good as any Jamba Juice and stands out as being exceptional. The price was very affordable that result's in an outstanding product leaving dry pulp to cook with. Great choice for anyone who enjoys juicing
customer_reviews.author: SanDiego

customer_reviews.title: Performs as expected
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, out of the box and juicing in 15 minutes, the best value for the money. Easy use, easy cleanup, quiet (for a juicer lol). There is a very small amount of moister left in the solids, but not worth another $100 to get a juicer that would extract that last tablespoon of juice. This is a great machine!
customer_reviews.author: 1fitspirit

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I wasn't sure which company to trust with up to $200. This one was cheap and I was skeptical on how reliable it would be and how long it would really last we've had it for about a year and it's still going strong. I would not personally recommend putting a whole apple in the juicer just because I think it puts unnecessary strain on the juicer when it only takes a couple seconds to cut the apple in half.
customer_reviews.author: EdandHelena

customer_reviews.title: Works so well.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the juicer regularly for a couple of months now and I love it. It is easy to assemble and unassemble and I love that it is machine washable. It also extracts a lot of juice. Compared to the Jack La Lanes power juicer I would say it is more user friendly and makes a fairly equal amount of juice.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Great Juicer!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful juicer, Super wide mouth, can stick a whole apple in that B. Great price, just the blade wore out after about a year of heavy juicing, but heard a replacement is cheap. Have lots of experience with juicers, and this one is powerful, gets all the liquid out, and worked great for several week long juice fasts. Remember! Juice your veggies, eat your fruits :-)
customer_reviews.author: mark twain

customer_reviews.title: Crappy quality
customer_reviews.text: Save your money, don't get this juicer. It's horrible, I had to run the pulp through 3 extra times to try to get all of the juice out and that still wasn't enough. Only good thing I can say is cleanup was pretty easy.... But if you are serious about juicing then invest and get a breville.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: I think its a great product so far
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this juicer a week ago and I've used it twice so far. It works very well. It's fairly easy to clean. The first time I used the juicer I used a bowl to capture the liquid because I was making more then one serving. Anyway some of the juice didn't make it in the bowl and ended up on the kitchen counter so you need to use something tall to capture all the liquid. Other then suggesting that the manufacturer include a container/pitcher; I really can't think of any complaints. It was a great price & I think its a great product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Lillybean

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted. Nothing less, nothing more
customer_reviews.text: This juicer was the perfect appliance for me. I was just starting with juicing and wasn't sure what to get with all of the options available. I didn't have the cash to throw at a $100-$200 juicer and this is the best option. It works really well, especially for the amateur juicer. It helps you get accustom to juicing and if you were to be serious about it, you could invest in one. It's really easy to clean and even dishwasher safe. I find myself making juices within 20 mins or less (this includes prep, juicing, and cleanup). It's a really good quality machine and I recommend it to anyone who wants a great juicer for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Juice Extractor
customer_reviews.text: I like that it takes large pieces of fruit but leaves too much pulp behind and cleaning it takes way longer than I'd like. Its super loud and shakes to the point that it can knock the glass or container over that your using to catch the juice. I recently bought a bullet, its much more user friendly, and doesnt waste any of the fruit or vegies used to make the juice.
customer_reviews.author: E.Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Juicer
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent juicer; it has a small "footprint" (doesn't take up too much counter space), is super easy to clean up after juicing, just whirrs everything up semi-quietly to make really healthy drinks - or even super sweet beverages. I would recommend it over the Jack LaLanne one that many of my relatives have!
customer_reviews.author: S. Moret

customer_reviews.title: greatProduct for the price
customer_reviews.text: This has lasted me for several years, However I don't use it daily or even weekly. I go through spurts where I want to be healthy and use it and it works great for that purpose!
customer_reviews.author: Cb1

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great juicer for the money, I would buy this again. Does a great job.Just push the fruit or veg in slowly so it doesnt get overworked. There are bigger more expensive models out there but if your new to juicing this is a great unit to see if juicing is for you.
customer_reviews.author: joeycaps

customer_reviews.title: Good for breakfast
customer_reviews.text: I bought this extractor because other wont support a complete carrot. With this product I combine carrots, apples (sliced in 4 pieces) and beetroot (Sliced) Beetroot it kind of hard and what I do is to combine, put in the extractor a carrot, then a couple of slice of beetroot and 1/4 of apple and so on. That way works just great.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge A. Cueva V

customer_reviews.title: A decent juicer with a powerful motor. As with ...
customer_reviews.text: A decent juicer with a powerful motor. As with any juicer, a dishwasher is necessary to keep cleanup from being a nightmare. This juicer does tend at times to grab larger chunks of fruit/veges and push them to the pulp container rather than fully juicing them.
customer_reviews.author: CB

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach 67601 Big Mouth Juice Extractor, Black (Discontinued)
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard Packaging

HAMILTON BEACH BIG MOUTH JUICE EXTRACTOR - 67601
Looking for an ideal juice drink that's fresh, free of preservatives and tastes 10 times better than store-bought juices? Take the plunge and go with the Big Mouth Juice Extractor from Hamilton Beach. It packs all the punch you would expect from a Hamilton Beach juice extractor: reliable efficiency, high speed and no-fuss cleanup.

Rated a "Best Buy" by a leading consumer advocacy publication, the Big Mouth Juice Extractor delivers on the juicing performance people ask for most, instead of skimping out on the nutrients they need. Equipped with a powerful 800-watt motor and extra-wide 3" feed chute that tears through almost anything you put in, it flawlessly performs the task of extracting the juice from whole fruits and vegetables in seconds. And that's not all. The designers of Hamilton Beach have minimized the fuss of cleanup, making all the removable plastic parts dishwasher safe.

Ideal for anyone who wants to personalize their juice drink recipes, rely on convenience for a busy schedule or help kick-start a healthy routine, the Big Mouth Juice Extractor is well worth the investment. 

PART OF A HEALTHY LIFESTYLE
Did you know that eating fruits and vegetables are an important part of a healthy lifestyle? According to studies by the USDA, eating more fruits and vegetables reduces your risk of chronic diseases like heart attacks and strokes, some cancers, heart disease, obesity, and type 2 diabetes, in addition to acute ailments like kidney stones and high blood pressure.

A glass of fresh, natural juice is an excellent, healthy way to begin your day or inject some serious energy into a lazy afternoon. With the Big Mouth Juice Extractor, healthy living is now easier, more convenient and more affordable. Designed and engineered for health-conscious people who want greater variety in their juicing routine, it can turn your whole fruits and vegetables into smooth juice form, while still keeping in all the nutrient-rich flavors your body needs. In just one 6 to 10-oz. serving (175-300 ml), one cycle of the Big Mouth Juice Extractor can fulfill the recommended daily value of Vitamin A and D, calcium, potassium, protein and fiber. 

PRODUCT FEATURES
 1.  Yields up to 24% more apple juice than a leading competitor
 2.  800 watts of peak power extracts juice from toughest of produce 
 3.  Extra-wide 3" feed chute fits whole fruits & vegetables, reducing prep time
 4.  Stainless steel cutter/strainer juices quickly
 5.  High juice spout funnels juice directly into a variety of glass or container sizes
 6.  Extra-large pulp bin provides for continuous juicing – no need to stop midway through juicing to empty the pulp bin
 7.  Designed for easy assembly, handling, operating and storage 
 8.  Removable plastic parts are dishwasher safe
 9.  Cleaning brush with micro-soft bristles provides easy strainer basket cleaning
 10. Rated "Best Buy" by a leading consumer advocacy publication 

VARIETY IS KEY
In addition to its speed and durability, the Big Mouth Juice Extractor comes with healthy recipes and suggestions for adding more vegetables to your day and "smart shopping" for the flavor and the season. Try out one of these healthy, delicious recipes to taste the difference in freshness: 

THE GO-GETTER
 * 4 medium kale leaves
 * 2 medium carrots, trimmed
 * 1 cup baby spinach leaves
 * 1 Granny Smith apple, quartered
 * 1/2 lemon, peeled
 * 1-inch piece fresh ginger, peeled

Juice all ingredients in order listed. Stir well and serve. Makes 2 servings 

SPICY VEGGIE DELIGHT
 * 2 broccoli flowerets with stalk
 * 1/4 green pepper
 * 1 carrot
 * 1 celery stalk
 *  1 tomato
 * Hot pepper sauce to taste

Juice all ingredients in order listed. Stir well and serve. Makes 1 serving 

ALTERNATIVE USES 
Not sure what to do with the leftover pulp? The leftover pulp is mostly fiber and cellulose, which like the juice, contains necessary vital nutrients for the daily diet. Any leftover pulp can be used in a variety of recipes, frothy drinks, casseroles or soups, as well as for garden composting. 

Thirsty for something other than juice? The Big Mouth Juice Extractor can help children, teens and adults get their daily vitamin intake with the option of making soy, almond or rice milk. To start, soak one cup of soybeans, almonds or rice in four cups of water for 24 to 48 hours in the refrigerator, and then slowly pour one cup into the food chute. The liquid extracted from the soaked mixture is "milk." For enhanced milk flavor, consider adding vanilla or honey. 

EASY CLEANING, MORE ENJOYING
Ease of cleaning is particularly important, because as with any small kitchen appliance, you will naturally use it more frequently if you can anticipate a hassle-free cleanup. With the Big Mouth Juice Extractor, it's easy to assemble and disassemble when preparing to juice or putting away. All parts – except for the motor base – are dishwasher safe. Here are some more easy-to-follow tips for effortless cleanup: 

 * Place a plastic grocery bag in the pulp bin container to collect the pulp and once juicing is complete, simply discard. 
 * When you're done juicing, pass the strainer basket under running water and brush off excess fiber buildup or pulp with included cleaning brush. 

TIPS & CARE 
Some extractors yield more juice than others, and the proportion of pulp to juice varies from fruit to fruit. Most fruits and vegetables such as apples, carrots and cucumbers will not need to be pre-cut into smaller pieces since they are likely to fit into the extra-wide feed chute. However, it is recommended that oranges, pineapples, melons and mangoes be peeled before placing in the unit to minimize impact on juice flavor. Also, all fruits with pits and large seeds, such as nectarines, peaches, apricots, plums and cherries MUST be pitted before juicing. To extract the maximum amount of juice every time, gently guide food down the feed chute slowly so that juice doesn't spray out of the spout. Do not allow pulp container to overfill, as this may prevent correct operation or damage to the unit.
feature_bullets: Powerful 800 watt motor makes fresh, delicious juice in seconds
Easy to assemble and store - just insert the strainer and lock on the lid with latches. No special tools needed
Extra-large pulp bin lets you juice longer - use pulp in recipes or for composting
Large, round chute for less pre-cutting
Recipes and cleaning brush included (cup not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,157 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
